thread.title: Newnan clinches berth, but region playoff race far from over
thread.title_full: Newnan clinches berth, but region playoff race far from over

title: Newnan clinches berth, but region playoff race far from over
text:
Newnan clinches berth, but region playoff race far from over by Comments 
MABLETON – For the Newnan Cougars, last year’s 3-7 record is a distant memory. 
Friday night in a Region 3- game at Pebblebrook, Newnan clinched a spot in the Class playoffs with a 27-14 victory. 
With the win, Newnan spoiled the Falcons’ Homecoming victory and improved its record to 7-2 overall and 4-1 in the region. 
Pebblebrook, which is under the direction of first-year head coach Kevin Saunders, dropped to 3-5 overall and 1-4 in Region 3- . 
The Cougars head into the final two games of the season (next week at home against rival East Coweta and the following week at Langston Hughes) guaranteed one of the four playoff spots in the region. 
“Our kids have been working really hard,” said Newnan head coach Mike McDonald. “We know there is still more work to do, but it’s good to know we are going to the playoffs.” 
Newnan took a 13-0 lead at the half, and added some insurance when K.D. Satterwhite returned the opening kickoff 82 yards for a touchdown to open the third quarter. 
Pebblebrook nearly answered on the ensuing kickoff, returning it to the Cougars’ 44. 
From there, the Falcons’ Wing-T offense put together one of its best drives of the night. 
Quarterback Jacobe Burke connected on a couple of passes and running back Tre Wright helped moved the ball to the goal line, but the Cougars defense came up with a goal line stand, stopping four straight quarterback sneaks just inches from a touchdown. 
“It’s a tricky offense, McDonald said of the Falcons. “They weren’t able to do too much in the first half, but they got rolling a little bit in the second.” 
After possession returned to Newnan on downs, the Cougars moved the ball to its own end zone on two long quarterback keepers from Chancellor Johnson. 
Pebblebrook cut the lead to 20-7 with 9:49 left in the fourth quarter when Ganni Montgomery converted a fourth-down play into an eight-yard TD. 
Martavious Parks added the final scored for Newnan on a 24-yard touchdown with 6:30 left in the game. 
Pebblebrook added its final score of the game when Montgomery caught a 26-yard touchdown pass. 
Pebblebrook drove the ball deep into Newnan territory on the opening series of the game, but Newnan defensive end Dezmand Pleasant recovered the fumble to end the drive. 
Neither team was able to score in the first quarter, but the Cougars finally got their offense clicking just seconds into the second quarter when Marquis Hill scored on a 40-yard run. 
The Cougars have won four out of their last five games while scoring at least 20 or more points. 
The Cougars head into next Friday’s rivalry trying to break a two-game losing streak against the Indians. 
“We know both East Coweta and Langston Hughes are are going to be a big challenge for us,” McDonald said. 
COUGARS 27, FALCONS 14 
Pebblebrook 0 0 0 14 — 14 
2nd quarter N—Marquis Hill 40 run (Rad 
Wyrick Kick), 11:50 N—Chancellor Johnson 4 shuffle pass to Darryel Hines (kick failed), 6:42

N—KD Satterwhite 82 yard kick return (Wyrick kick), 11:50 
4th Quarter 
P—Ganni Montgomery 8-yard run (kick good), 9:49 N—Martavious Parks 24 yard run (Wyrick kick), 6:30 P—Montgomery 26 touchdown pass from Burke 3:24 More
